entity.name: DX
entity.description: Learnability, API ergonomics (DX), cognitive overhead, things being too low-level, confusing, annoying, or a hassle.

example.code:
const adapter = await navigator.gpu.requestAdapter();
const device = await adapter?.requestDevice();

entity.name: `navigator.xr` (WebXR Device API)
entity.description: Create AR/VR sessions with compatible output devices.
entity.descriptionClean: Create AR/VR sessions with compatible output devices.

example.code:
const xr = navigator.xr;
const session = await xr?.requestSession("immersive-vr");
example.codeHighlighted: const xr = navigator.xr; const session = await xr?.requestSession("immersive-vr");

webFeature.description_html: The navigator.xr API represents the browser's virtual reality or augmented reality system. You can use to request a WebXR session.
webFeature.name: WebXR

entity.name: Resource Hints
entity.description:
Begin work on certain resources early to improve performance.
Syntax: `<link rel="pre* | dns-prefetch | modulepreload">`.
entity.descriptionHtml: Begin work on certain resources early to improve performance. Syntax: <link rel="pre* | dns-prefetch | modulepreload">.
entity.descriptionClean: Begin work on certain resources early to improve performance.Syntax: <link rel="pre* | dns-prefetch | modulepreload">.

example.codeHighlighted: <link rel="preload" href="picture.jpg" /> <link rel="dns-prefetch" href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/" />

resources.title: Understanding CSS preload and other resource hints - LogRocket Blog

entity.name: ``
entity.description: The `sizes="auto"` attribute reserves layout space for an image before it loads, avoiding some layout shifts.
entity.descriptionHtml: The sizes="auto" attribute reserves layout space for an image before it loads, avoiding some layout shifts.
entity.descriptionClean: The sizes="auto" attribute reserves layout space for an image before it loads, avoiding some layout shifts.

webFeature.description_html: The sizes="auto" attribute for the <img> HTML element reserves layout space for an image before it loads, avoiding some layout shifts. This attribute only applies to images with the loading="lazy" attribute.
